Harry Potter fans can get all eight mainline films on 4K Blu-ray for only $56 during Amazon's Black Friday sale. The Harry Potter 8-Film Collection normally sells for around $90, so this is a pretty awesome deal. In fact, it's the best price of the year for the collection.

The eight-movie collection includes all of the Harry Potter movies, including the two-part Deathly Hallows. The films in the bundle include Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone, Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban, Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire, Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix, Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince, and Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Parts 1 and 2.

The 4K HDR movies are said to include brighter and more lifelike colors compared to earlier versions, while the films have upgraded audio as well. If you're into numbers, you're getting 16 discs and 1,179 total minutes of Harry Potter action. There are plenty of bonus features, too, that help explain how the filmmakers brought the vision to life.

For more Blu-ray deals, check out our roundup of the best movie and TV box set deals and our list of notable 4K Blu-rays in Amazon's B2G1 Free Blu-ray sale.

More Harry Potter Black Friday Deals

Amazon has several other notable Harry Potter deals for Black Friday. The recently released MinaLima Box Set of the first three books in the series is on sale for $79 (was $116). MinaLima was the graphic design studio for the film series; the studio has also made very unique editions of the books as well as popular classic novels like The Wonderful Wizard of Oz. These editions of The Sorcerer's Stone, Chamber of Secrets, and Prisoner of Azkaban have full-color illustrations on almost every page and interactive papercraft elements. The books are sold individually as well, and all three are eligible for Amazon's B2G1 Free Book Sale.
